t: Amos 7
Vision of the Locusts
Thus*p the Lord God*s showed me: Behold, He formed locust swarms at the beginning of the late crop; indeed it*i was*i the late crop after the king’s mowings.
And so it was, when they had finished eating the grass of the land, that I said: “O*pn Lord God,*s forgive, I pray! Oh,*ld that Jacob may stand, For*ld he is*i small!”
So*ild the Lord*s relented concerning this. “It*ld shall not be,” said the Lord.*s
Vision of the Fire
Thus*p the Lord God*s showed me: Behold, the Lord God*s called for conflict by fire, and it consumed the great deep and devoured the territory.
Then I said: “O*pn Lord God,*s cease, I pray! Oh,*ld that Jacob may stand, For*ld he is*i small!”
So*ild the Lord*s relented concerning this. “This*ld also shall not be,” said the Lord God.*s
Vision of the Plumb Line
Thus*p He showed me: Behold, the Lord stood on a wall made*i with a plumb line, with a plumb line in His hand.

And the Lord*s said to me, “Amos, what do you see?” And*p I said, “A plumb line.” Then*p the Lord said: “Behold,*pn I am setting a plumb line In*ld the midst of My people Israel; I*ld will not pass by them anymore.
The*ld high places of Isaac shall be desolate, And*ld the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste. I*ld will rise with the sword against the house of Jeroboam.”
Amaziah’s Complaint
Then*p Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel. The land is not able to bear all his words.
For thus Amos has said: ‘Jeroboam*pn shall die by the sword, And*ld Israel shall surely be led away captive From*ld their own land.’”
Then*p Amaziah said to Amos: “Go,*pn you seer! Flee*ld to the land of Judah. There*ld eat bread, And*ld there prophesy.
But*ld never again prophesy at Bethel, For*ld it is*i the king’s sanctuary, And*ld it is*i the royal residence.”
Then*p Amos answered, and said to Amaziah: “I*pn was*i no prophet, Nor*ld was*i I a son of a prophet, But*ld I was*i a sheepbreeder And*ld a tender of sycamore fruit.
Then*ld the Lord*s took me as I followed the flock, And*ld the Lord*s said to me, ‘Go,*ld prophesy to My people Israel.’
Now*ld therefore, hear the word of the Lord:*s You*ld say, ‘Do not prophesy against Israel, And*ld do not spout against the house of Isaac.’

“Therefore*p thus says the Lord:*s ‘Your*pn wife shall be a harlot in the city; Your*ld sons and daughters shall fall by the sword; Your*ld land shall be divided by survey*i line; You*ld shall die in a defiled land; And*ld Israel shall surely be led away captive From*ld his own land.’”
